title: Tuskegee University veterinary student, 20, collapses and dies on campus
text:
A Tuskegee University sophomore has died after suddenly collapsing on the Alabama campus while her great-aunt was on the phone with her.

University President Lily McNair announced in a statement that Nyra Shaw-Hemphill, 20, experienced some kind of a medical emergency last Thursday and was rushed to East Alabama Medical Center, where she was later pronounced dead.

A medical examiner has yet to release Shaw-Hemphill's cause of death.

Gone too soon: Tuskegee University sophomore Nyra Shaw-Hemphill collapsed and died on Thursday. The Ohio native was just 20 years old

Shaw-Hemphill was on the Tuskegee, Alabama, campus at the time of the fatal incident

The 20-year-old was from Cincinnati, Ohio, and was majoring in animal, poultry and veterinary science.

Shaw-Hemphill's great-aunt, Judy Anthony, told the station WVTM that around the time of the student's collapse, she called her.

'In the background I could hear them screaming, "She’s gone, she’s gone,"' the relative recalled.

So Anthony and other family members got in the car and drove the nine hours from Cincinnati to Tuskegee, Alabama, to find out what had happened.

Grieving family members say Shaw-Hemphill's dream was to become a veterinarian.

She graduated in 2017 from Hughes STEM High School in Cincinnati, where she was on the cheer squad and won several academic awards.

Shaw-Hemphill graduated in 2017 from Hughes STEM High School in Cincinnati, where she was on the cheer squad (left) and won several academic awards

Family members say the young woman dreamed of becoming a veterinarian

'She had a very beautiful spirit. She was beautiful inside and out,' Anthony said.

Shaw-Hemphill is survived by her mother, registered nurse and Tuskegee graduate Terrie Shaw.

The university honored Shaw-Hemphill with moments of silence on Friday and Sunday, which will be followed by a memorial service on Wednesday morning.

'We will announce funeral arrangements when they have been provided by Nyra’s family. In the meantime, and in the days and weeks that follow, I ask you to please continue to keep her family and friends in your thoughts and prayers,' President McNair said in her statement.
description: Tuskegee University sophomore Nyra Shaw-Hemphill, 20, collapsed on campus in Alabama on Thursday and was rushed to a hospital, where she was later pronounced dead.
